stream_context.summary: Kaze spends most of the session prototyping the beach section of the overworld—tweaking sand and grass blends, experimenting with animated shoreline foam, placing rocks, paths and bunny-footprint decals, and hunting a code bug that stops the foam routine. The stream also features a prolonged digression on whether the C keyword "const" produces faster MIPS code.

development_findings.summary: Incrementing the routine-flags inside the shoreline-foam function caused the draw routine to stop after one call; leaving the flags unchanged fixed the animation.
development_findings.quote: Is the problem that I'm incrementing the flags? ... You're not allowed to increase the flags.

development_findings.summary: Fast64 exporter currently introduces vertex-colour and random-mode bugs; Kaze is forced to tolerate visual glitches until the tool is patched.
development_findings.quote: It's a Fast64 bug. Nothing I can do about that.

development_findings.summary: Kaze replaced the old audio plugin because it distorted music; the new plugin restores proper OST quality.
development_findings.quote: Fun fact, I had to change the audio plugin, because there was a bug in the old audio plugin that made the music sound terrible.

development_findings.summary: Sauraen is writing a version of the legacy vertex pipeline that can toggle a Fresnel-style effect; Kaze is waiting for that before testing certain water features.
development_findings.quote: Sauraen is working on a version of the legacy vertex pipeline that enables Fresnel like a flag.

development_findings.summary: Overworld will evolve during the game: obstacles, characters and scenery (e.g., treasure chests on the beach, flower groves) appear as the story advances.
development_findings.quote: The overworld changes throughout the game. It's supposed to feel alive.

development_findings.summary: Interactive coconuts are planned: kicking palm trees will drop 0-5 coin coconuts and may wake a sleeping NPC.
development_findings.quote: All the coconut trees have coconuts. You can kick them to make them drop the coconuts that may have 0 to 5 coins in them.

development_findings.summary: Kaze demonstrated that marking tables "const" lets GCC omit two memory loads and four MIPS instructions, arguing for selective use of const for speed.
development_findings.quote: Remove the const ... compile again … four instructions less. It optimized out the memory read because it's const.

development_findings.summary: Light-mapping is impractical on N64 because only one UV set is available; any light map would have to share identical UVs with geometry.
development_findings.quote: You can only have one UV mapper ... in practice you can say it can't do it.

development_findings.summary: Planned footprint decal system: Zeina is supplying a strip of rotated bunny-paw images (128×32 IA-8) that repeat into a trail towards the cave entrance.
Sand/grass colour balance remains unsolved; darker shoreline sand, raised dunes and later Biobak polish are expected.

context_findings.summary: Kaze prides himself on frugality (still uses a 10-year-old Galaxy S6, hates spending money) and bench-presses 315 lbs.
context_findings.quote: My phone is so old, it cannot play YouTube videos … you have no idea how much of a cheap fuck I am.

context_findings.summary: He enjoys keeping fish (pleco, guppies, shrimp) and dreams of extravagant aquariums if he were wealthy.
context_findings.quote: You guys know what I love? I love keeping fishes … it's the coolest thing ever.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s philosophy: welcomes correction but dislikes uninformed certainty; uses live debugging and assembly inspection to prove points.
context_findings.quote: We have proven that I'm someone who doesn't really take any issue with being corrected. I just care about becoming as good as possible.

context_findings.summary: Avoids viewing Nintendo Giga-Leak assets to dodge legal risk.
context_findings.quote: I did kind of want to look at it because that is, like, hella views, but because of the legal implications.

context_findings.summary: Prefers not to buy new consoles at launch; sceptical of Switch 2 pricing plus taxes.
context_findings.quote: All consoles at launch are a bad investment.

biobak.summary: Provides shader and texture guidance; will refine beach materials after Kaze establishes a placeholder version.
biobak.quote: I'm just getting something like semi decent going so then when Biobak starts working on this, he has a good starting point.

biobak.summary: Suggested technical alternatives for foam rendering and offered critical feedback on sand colours.

badub.summary: Composed new orchestral overworld and Course 1 tracks, still using Mario 64’s original instrument set.
badub.quote: I think having orchestra music is cooler … I'm pretty sure the OST of this is mostly composed with the same instruments as the vanilla game.

badub.summary: Fans already stream Badub’s unfinished tracks on SoundCloud; ranks fourth in his listener stats.

zeina.summary: Created the bunny-footprint decal texture at Kaze’s request and iterated (adding random rotations).
zeina.quote: Looks good, Zeina. I will try that in a bit.

zeina.summary: Coined the family nickname "Debooba" for their child and occasionally triggers household distractions during streams.
zeina.quote: Debooba is my child … Zeina just started calling her that and now she is Debooba.

key_stories.title: The Const Debate
key_stories.summary: A chatter claimed that the C keyword "const" never affects performance. Kaze paused level work, wrote a test, and demonstrated that GCC removes two memory loads and four instructions when a table is marked const.
key_stories.challenge: Chat doubted Kaze’s statement that const can speed up code.
key_stories.process: Created a small function, compiled with and without const, disassembled both, and compared opcodes.
key_stories.outcome: Chat conceded the micro-optimization; Kaze reaffirmed his approach to provable performance tuning.
key_stories.key_quote: I remove the const, compile again—four instructions less. What more proof do you need?

key_stories.title: Shoreline Foam Stops Rendering
key_stories.summary: Kaze discovered that the newly written shoreline-foam routine only ran once. After debugging, he realised incrementing its internal flags prevented further calls.
key_stories.challenge: Foam animation played one frame, then froze.
key_stories.process: Inserted print statements, examined flag logic, removed the flag increment.
key_stories.outcome: Foam animates correctly, though Fast64 exporter still causes visual errors needing future fixes.
key_stories.key_quote: Is the problem that I'm incrementing the flags? … You're not allowed to increase the flags.

key_stories.title: Audio Plugin Swap
key_stories.summary: Music quality in the current build sounded distorted. Kaze traced the issue to the emulator audio plugin and replaced it, restoring Badub’s tracks.
key_stories.challenge: Overworld music played with noticeable artifacts.
key_stories.process: Tested alternate plugins and configured the new one.
key_stories.outcome: Sound quality is acceptable again; further engine work remains.
key_stories.key_quote: I had to change the audio plugin, because there was a bug in the old audio plugin that made the music sound terrible.

open_questions.topic: Legacy vertex pipeline with Fresnel flag
open_questions.context: Kaze mentions Sauraen is adding this but offers no timeline or details.
questions: What specific visual effects will the Fresnel flag enable?
How close is the feature to completion?
Will it affect performance on real N64 hardware?

open_questions.context: Kaze says the island evolves (e.g., washed-up chests, blooming groves) but no technical plan given.
questions: Which events trigger each overworld transformation?
How are these state changes stored on N64 saves?

open_questions.context: Concept: kick palms to drop coin-filled coconuts and wake NPCs; not yet implemented.
questions: Has collision logic or object code been started?
Will falling coconuts hurt Mario or only NPCs?
How does coin randomization work under deterministic RNG?

open_questions.context: Exporter corrupts random-mode and vertex colours.
questions: What is the root cause and who is fixing it?
Is there a fallback pipeline if Fast64 remains unstable?
Does this delay level-design collaboration with Biobak?

open_questions.context: Kaze is dissatisfied with current colours and defers to Biobak.
questions: Which references or real locations inspire the target palette?
Will custom vertex colours or texture baking achieve the blend?
How much texture memory is budgeted for the beach zone?
